entry.name: Adaptive COVID-19 Treatment Trial (ACTT) participants
COVID-19
Remdesivir Cohort in Adaptive COVID-19 Treatment Trial (ACTT) participants
Placebo Cohort in Adaptive COVID-19 Treatment Trial (ACTT) participants
Remdesivir
entry.description: 200 mg of Remdesivir administered intravenously on Day 1, followed by a 100 mg once-daily maintenance dose of Remdesivir while hospitalized for up to a 10 days total course

entry.name: Placebo
entry.description: 200 mg of Remdesivir placebo administered intravenously on Day 1, followed by a 100 mg once-daily maintenance dose of Remdesivir placebo while hospitalized for up to a 10 days total course

entry.name: Age
Age between 18 and 65 years
Age >=65 years
Male Sex
Female Sex
Mild to Moderate Disease
entry.description: SpO2 > 94% and respiratory rate < 24 breaths/min without supplemental oxygen

entry.name: Severe Disease
entry.description: requiring mechanical ventilation, requiring oxygen, a SpO2 = 94% on room air, or tachypnea (respiratory rate = 24 breaths/min)

entry.name: Time to Recovery time from start 28 days
entry.description: Day of recovery is defined as the first day on which the subject satisfies one of the following three categories from the ordinal scale: 1) Hospitalized, not requiring supplemental oxygen - no longer requires ongoing medical care; 2) Not hospitalized, limitation on activities and/or requiring home oxygen; 3) Not hospitalized, no limitations on activities.

entry.name: ALT-Change from Baseline at Day 3 time from start 2 days
entry.description: Blood to evaluate Alanine Transaminase (ALT)  was collected at Days 1, 3, 5, 8, and 11 while participants were inpatient, and at Days 15 and 29, with the Day 1 assessment serving as baseline. Participants who had been discharged had blood collected if infection control measures allowed for in-person visits after discharge

entry.name: Adverse Events Grade 3 or 4 at Day 29 time from start 28 days
entry.description: Grade 3 AEs are defined as events that interrupt usual activities of daily living, or significantly affects clinical status, or may require intensive therapeutic intervention. Severe events are usually incapacitating. Grade 4 AEs are defined as events that are potentially life threatening

entry.name: Serious Adverse Events at Day 29 time from start 28 days
entry.description: An SAE is defined as an AE or suspected adverse reaction is considered serious if, in the view of either the investigator or the sponsor, it results in death, a life-threatening AE, inpatient hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization, a persistent or significant incapacity or substantial disruption of the ability to conduct normal life functions, or a congenital anomaly/birth defect.

entry.name: Incomplete Dosing Due to Discharge time from start 9 days
entry.description: Participants discontinued from investigational therapeutics due to discharge before Day 10

entry.name: Incomplete Dosing Due to Death time from start 9 days
entry.description: Participants discontinued from investigational therapeutics due to death by Day 10

entry.name: Incomplete Dosing (ANY reason) time from start 9 days
entry.description: Participants discontinued from Investigational Therapeutics or Received less than 10 doses

entry.name: Received all 10 intended doses time from start 9 days
Duration of Hospitalization/ITT time from start 28 days
entry.description: Duration of hospitalization including imputations for participants who died.

entry.name: Duration of Hospitalization/Survivors time from start 28 days
entry.description: Duration of hospitalization restricted to participants who did not die

entry.name: Duration of New Ventilator/ECMO Use time from start 28 days
entry.description: Duration of new ventilator or ECMO use was measured in days among participants who were not on a ventilator or ECMO at baseline including imputations for participants who died.

entry.name: Duration of New Ventilator/ECMO Use (Survivors) time from start 28 days
entry.description: Duration of new ventilator or ECMO use was measured in days among participants who were not on a ventilator or ECMO at baseline,  restricted to participants who did not die

entry.name: New Ventilator or ECMO Use time from start 28 days
